pull.title: Make RPC password resistant to timing attacks
pull.body:
Fixes issue#2838; this is a tweaked version of pull#2845 that
should not leak the length of the password and is more generic,
in case we run into other situations where we need
timing-attack-resistant comparisons.

repo.name: bitcoin-git
repo.description: Feature branches that aren't yet, or never will be, ready for mainline bitcoin

events.message:
Make RPC password resistant to timing attacks

Fixes issue#2838; this is a tweaked version of pull#2845 that
should not leak the length of the password and is more generic,
in case we run into other situations where we need
timing-attack-resistant comparisons.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/42656ea2e552b027e174fdceab7348ffcb8245c4 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
ACK.  This does leak some timing data if bsize==0 or not, but I think this is inconsequential, I'm only mentioning it in case others didn't realize it and might care.

issue.title: Mitigate Timing Attacks On Basic RPC Authorization
issue.body:
As per #2838 . Eliminates the possibility of timing attacks by changing the way the two passwords are compared. 
It iterates through each char in the strings, and if the two chars it is comparing aren't the same, then it adds 1 to nReturn and the function, once it's done comparing all the chars, will return false. Previously, the function would return false on the first char that didn't match, allowing a possible attacker to run a timing attack.

See http://rdist.root.org/2010/01/07/timing-independent-array-comparison/ for reference.

issue.title: Timing leak in RPC authentication
